intro: Celsia freynii, commonly known as the Freyn's celsia, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Celsia freynii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
